document.docAuthor: Soldati Lacerda, Déborah S. & Monteiro Machado, Angelo B.
document.masterDocTitle: The damselfly genus Mecistogaster (Odonata: Pseudostigmatidae) from the Brazilian Atlantic Forest with a description of three new species and a neotype designation for M. amalia (Burmeister, 1839)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The damselfly genus Mecistogaster (Odonata: Pseudostigmatidae) from the Brazilian Atlantic Forest with a description of three new species and a neotype designation for M. amalia (Burmeister, 1839)

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Neotype .
♁ ( ABMM ), Brazil , Minas Gerais State , Inconfidentes , Fazenda do Instituto Federal ( 22° 18’ 42” S , 46° 19’ 30” W ),
16.III.2017
, M. M. Cajubi leg .

♀ ( ABMM ), Brazil , Minas Gerais State , Inconfidentes , Fazenda do Instituto Federal ( 22° 18’ 42” S , 46° 19’ 30” W ),
16.III.2017
, M. M. Cajubi leg .

subSubSection.paragraph: Neotype found in copula with first described female.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 4–7. Males of Atlantic Forest species of
Mecistogaster
. (4)
Mecistogaster amalia
, specimen compared with neotype: head in dorso-anterior view; (5–6)
Mecistogaster mielkei
sp. nov.
, holotype: (5) prothorax in dorsal view; paratype: (6) pterothorax in ventral view;
Mecistogaster kesselringi
sp. nov.
, paratype: (7) pterothorax in ventral view.
